title: Back End Engineer (NodeJS)
description: FORTVISION’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than hundreds microservices, handling daily traffic of about 50 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies. Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. Responsibilities: You are an awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 2 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. description: Our smART+™ platform is a sensor-based feeding system for intensive care unit (ICU) patients. description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

We recently introduced Nutrition Management 2.0™, which is a comprehensive, guideline-driven approach that aims to improve nutrition while reducing feeding complications. Combined with our smART+™ platform, it monitors, analyzes, and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspirations in real time. By improving nutrition and achieving 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform greatly reduces hospital-acquired complications and speeds up ICU patient recovery. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.  Requirements:

title: Back End Engineer (NodeJS)
description: FORTVISION’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than hundreds microservices, handling daily traffic of about 50 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies. Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. Responsibilities: You are an awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 2 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of NodeJS, AWS and know functional programming principles. You care about design and microservices architecture, take responsibility and can work independently.

title: Software Engineer
description: Innovid (NYSE:CTV) powers advertising delivery, personalization, measurement and outcomes across linear, CTV and digital for the world's largest brands. Through a global infrastructure that enables cross-platform ad serving, data-driven creative, and currency-grade measurement, Innovid offers its clients always-on intelligence to optimize advertising investment across channels, platforms, screens, and devices. Innovid is an independent platform that leads the market in converged TV innovation, through proprietary technology and exclusive partnerships designed to reimagine TV advertising. Headquartered in New York City, Innovid serves a global client base through offices across the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific. To learn more, visit innovid.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. We have a developer-centric culture, practice continuous deployment and no code ownership, and deal daily with the most advanced technologies and methodologies in software development, high scalability, and fully automated and tested pipelines. We're looking for top-notch, passionate developers to be part of our world-class R&D team. If you think you can handle a wide range of technologies, pushing code to production several times a day, working on a different part of our product code with every new task you getת and using the best practices in the industry? please contact us!

title: Software Engineer - Agent Team - Identity and Network Access
description: It’s a rare opportunity to develop new products, especially large and strategic investments in a well-established organization. If you’ve been waiting for that kind of opportunity to come along, this may be the career opportunity for you.  The Identity and Network Access team is searching for software engineers across all disciplines, who can define, build, and evolve heavily integrated platforms at scale. Our team is part of the Security organization in Microsoft and is responsible for bringing networking, identity, and security together. In these times, where working from anywhere has never been more important, it is our set of services that enables people around the world to stay productive every day, while still meeting companies’ security and compliance needs. Our cloud services are built to solve these challenges for our customers in a seamless and integrated stack as we constantly push ourselves to stay at the cutting edge of the industry. title: Backend Software Developer - Israel
description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

title: Python Software Development Engineer - Graviton, AWS - Annapurna Labs
description: Bsc in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering 5+ years of experience as an automation developer Experience in programming with Python & Bash Experience in developing infrastructure 5+ years of experience in embedded systems testing SW/HW Experience in working with GIT Experience in working with Linux Ability to work independently Annapurna Labs, an Amazon company, plays a significant role in AWS's success by developing Graviton servers. Graviton servers are ARM-based processors that provide better performance and cost-effectiveness for running various compute-intensive applications on the cloud.  As a Python Software Development Engineer in our team, you will be responsible for the Graviton servers' software quality. That includes setting up and maintenance of lab and cloud environments, writing test-plans, automating them and troubleshooting issues. You will take part in designing, developing, and maintaining our automation frameworks and will work closely with developers to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality Graviton servers to our customers.  In this team, you will solve difficult technical problems, work on test frameworks, test tools, and test case automation for large components. You will build and apply solutions that assess and mitigate quality risks on the Graviton servers.   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AaYNwOh90Pg&t=2090s https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/graviton/  Key job responsibilities In this highly technical position, the Python Software Engineer will have strong scripting abilities in python to write tests to constantly check the functionality of the Graviton servers' software. Experience coding in python and testing embedded systems are both key to success. You are able to function as a significant autonomous contributor, providing consistently high quality work, and maintainable code. You will apply software testing techniques and assess the testability of components/features built by development teams  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Tel Aviv, ISR

title: Backend Software Developer - Israel
description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

title: Software Engineer - Agent Team - Identity and Network Access
description: It’s a rare opportunity to develop new products, especially large and strategic investments in a well-established organization. If you’ve been waiting for that kind of opportunity to come along, this may be the career opportunity for you.  The Identity and Network Access team is searching for software engineers across all disciplines, who can define, build, and evolve heavily integrated platforms at scale. Our team is part of the Security organization in Microsoft and is responsible for bringing networking, identity, and security together. In these times, where working from anywhere has never been more important, it is our set of services that enables people around the world to stay productive every day, while still meeting companies’ security and compliance needs. Our cloud services are built to solve these challenges for our customers in a seamless and integrated stack as we constantly push ourselves to stay at the cutting edge of the industry. title: Software Engineer
description: Innovid (NYSE:CTV) powers advertising delivery, personalization, measurement and outcomes across linear, CTV and digital for the world's largest brands. Through a global infrastructure that enables cross-platform ad serving, data-driven creative, and currency-grade measurement, Innovid offers its clients always-on intelligence to optimize advertising investment across channels, platforms, screens, and devices. Innovid is an independent platform that leads the market in converged TV innovation, through proprietary technology and exclusive partnerships designed to reimagine TV advertising. Headquartered in New York City, Innovid serves a global client base through offices across the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific. To learn more, visit innovid.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. We have a developer-centric culture, practice continuous deployment and no code ownership, and deal daily with the most advanced technologies and methodologies in software development, high scalability, and fully automated and tested pipelines. We're looking for top-notch, passionate developers to be part of our world-class R&D team. If you think you can handle a wide range of technologies, pushing code to production several times a day, working on a different part of our product code with every new task you getת and using the best practices in the industry? please contact us!

title: Back End Engineer (NodeJS)
description: FORTVISION’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than hundreds microservices, handling daily traffic of about 50 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies. Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. Responsibilities: You are an awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 2 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of NodeJS, AWS and know functional programming principles. You care about design and microservices architecture, take responsibility and can work independently.

title: Frontend Software Engineer - Air Platform
description: NVIDIA has been redefining computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s an outstanding legacy of innovation that’s motivated by extraordinary technology —and amazing people. NVIDIA is looking for an experienced UI/UX Angular Developer to join our Air team – the Digital Twin for Data Center Simulation web application. To learn more, visit https://air.nvidia.com. As a UI/UX Front End Angular Developer, you will be tasked with designing and building interactive and feature-rich interfaces for the Air simulation platform that will help shape the user experience of our innovative software. This position offers the opportunity to have a real impact in an influential, technology-focused company impacting product lines that power the most advanced data centers in the world. We have crafted a team of outstanding people, whose mission is to push the frontiers of what is possible today and define the platform for the future of data center simulation and design.

title: Backend Software Developer
description: Our smART+™ platform is a sensor-based feeding system for intensive care unit (ICU) patients. It aims to prevent life-threatening complications such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. We recently introduced Nutrition Management 2.0™, which is a comprehensive, guideline-driven approach that aims to improve nutrition while reducing feeding complications. Combined with our smART+™ platform, it monitors, analyzes, and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspirations in real time. By improving nutrition and achieving 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform greatly reduces hospital-acquired complications and speeds up ICU patient recovery. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.  Requirements:

title: Software Engineer
description: Innovid (NYSE:CTV) powers advertising delivery, personalization, measurement and outcomes across linear, CTV and digital for the world's largest brands. Through a global infrastructure that enables cross-platform ad serving, data-driven creative, and currency-grade measurement, Innovid offers its clients always-on intelligence to optimize advertising investment across channels, platforms, screens, and devices. Innovid is an independent platform that leads the market in converged TV innovation, through proprietary technology and exclusive partnerships designed to reimagine TV advertising. Headquartered in New York City, Innovid serves a global client base through offices across the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific. To learn more, visit innovid.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. We have a developer-centric culture, practice continuous deployment and no code ownership, and deal daily with the most advanced technologies and methodologies in software development, high scalability, and fully automated and tested pipelines. We're looking for top-notch, passionate developers to be part of our world-class R&D team. If you think you can handle a wide range of technologies, pushing code to production several times a day, working on a different part of our product code with every new task you getת and using the best practices in the industry? please contact us!

title: Back End Engineer (NodeJS)
description: FORTVISION’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than hundreds microservices, handling daily traffic of about 50 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies. Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. Responsibilities: You are an awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 2 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of NodeJS, AWS and know functional programming principles. You care about design and microservices architecture, take responsibility and can work independently.

title: Backend Software Developer - Israel
description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

description: It’s a rare opportunity to develop new products, especially large and strategic investments in a well-established organization. Our team is part of the Security organization in Microsoft and is responsible for bringing networking, identity, and security together. In these times, where working from anywhere has never been more important, it is our set of services that enables people around the world to stay productive every day, while still meeting companies’ security and compliance needs. Our cloud services are built to solve these challenges for our customers in a seamless and integrated stack as we constantly push ourselves to stay at the cutting edge of the industry.                          Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. title: Python Software Development Engineer - Graviton, AWS - Annapurna Labs
description: Bsc in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering 5+ years of experience as an automation developer Experience in programming with Python & Bash Experience in developing infrastructure 5+ years of experience in embedded systems testing SW/HW Experience in working with GIT Experience in working with Linux Ability to work independently Annapurna Labs, an Amazon company, plays a significant role in AWS's success by developing Graviton servers. Graviton servers are ARM-based processors that provide better performance and cost-effectiveness for running various compute-intensive applications on the cloud.  As a Python Software Development Engineer in our team, you will be responsible for the Graviton servers' software quality. That includes setting up and maintenance of lab and cloud environments, writing test-plans, automating them and troubleshooting issues. You will take part in designing, developing, and maintaining our automation frameworks and will work closely with developers to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality Graviton servers to our customers.  In this team, you will solve difficult technical problems, work on test frameworks, test tools, and test case automation for large components. You will build and apply solutions that assess and mitigate quality risks on the Graviton servers.   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AaYNwOh90Pg&t=2090s https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/graviton/  Key job responsibilities In this highly technical position, the Python Software Engineer will have strong scripting abilities in python to write tests to constantly check the functionality of the Graviton servers' software. Experience coding in python and testing embedded systems are both key to success. You are able to function as a significant autonomous contributor, providing consistently high quality work, and maintainable code. You will apply software testing techniques and assess the testability of components/features built by development teams  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Tel Aviv, ISR

description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

title: Python Software Development Engineer - Graviton, AWS - Annapurna Labs
description: Bsc in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering 5+ years of experience as an automation developer Experience in programming with Python & Bash Experience in developing infrastructure 5+ years of experience in embedded systems testing SW/HW Experience in working with GIT Experience in working with Linux Ability to work independently Annapurna Labs, an Amazon company, plays a significant role in AWS's success by developing Graviton servers. Graviton servers are ARM-based processors that provide better performance and cost-effectiveness for running various compute-intensive applications on the cloud.  As a Python Software Development Engineer in our team, you will be responsible for the Graviton servers' software quality. That includes setting up and maintenance of lab and cloud environments, writing test-plans, automating them and troubleshooting issues. You will take part in designing, developing, and maintaining our automation frameworks and will work closely with developers to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality Graviton servers to our customers.  In this team, you will solve difficult technical problems, work on test frameworks, test tools, and test case automation for large components. You will build and apply solutions that assess and mitigate quality risks on the Graviton servers.   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AaYNwOh90Pg&t=2090s https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/graviton/  Key job responsibilities In this highly technical position, the Python Software Engineer will have strong scripting abilities in python to write tests to constantly check the functionality of the Graviton servers' software. Experience coding in python and testing embedded systems are both key to success. You are able to function as a significant autonomous contributor, providing consistently high quality work, and maintainable code. You will apply software testing techniques and assess the testability of components/features built by development teams  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Tel Aviv, ISR

description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

description: FORTVISION’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

title: Software Engineer - Agent Team - Identity and Network Access
description: It’s a rare opportunity to develop new products, especially large and strategic investments in a well-established organization. If you’ve been waiting for that kind of opportunity to come along, this may be the career opportunity for you.  The Identity and Network Access team is searching for software engineers across all disciplines, who can define, build, and evolve heavily integrated platforms at scale. Our team is part of the Security organization in Microsoft and is responsible for bringing networking, identity, and security together. In these times, where working from anywhere has never been more important, it is our set of services that enables people around the world to stay productive every day, while still meeting companies’ security and compliance needs. Our cloud services are built to solve these challenges for our customers in a seamless and integrated stack as we constantly push ourselves to stay at the cutting edge of the industry.                          Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. title: Frontend Software Engineer - Air Platform
description: NVIDIA has been redefining computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s an outstanding legacy of innovation that’s motivated by extraordinary technology —and amazing people. NVIDIA is looking for an experienced UI/UX Angular Developer to join our Air team – the Digital Twin for Data Center Simulation web application. To learn more, visit https://air.nvidia.com. As a UI/UX Front End Angular Developer, you will be tasked with designing and building interactive and feature-rich interfaces for the Air simulation platform that will help shape the user experience of our innovative software. This position offers the opportunity to have a real impact in an influential, technology-focused company impacting product lines that power the most advanced data centers in the world. We have crafted a team of outstanding people, whose mission is to push the frontiers of what is possible today and define the platform for the future of data center simulation and design.

title: React + Node.JS Developer
description: תיאור המשרה !RealCommerce is growing and looking for React + Node.JS Developer About us ? RealCommerce develops top-end websites, mobile apps and dynamic digital solutions for leading organizations. From an order approval to a project delivery, we are committed to your product, your budget and the project time line. דרישות התפקיד 2 + years of experience in software development - must. At least 2 years of experience in client-side development, using the advanced versions of React + NodeJS - must. Experience working with React Native - required. Experience in building a Rest API based on a Web API - required. Experience working with JavaScript - required. Full control of HTML, CSS - required. Experience in backend technologies - an advantage.

title: Backend Software Developer
description: Our smART+™ platform is a sensor-based feeding system for intensive care unit (ICU) patients. It aims to prevent life-threatening complications such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. We recently introduced Nutrition Management 2.0™, which is a comprehensive, guideline-driven approach that aims to improve nutrition while reducing feeding complications. Combined with our smART+™ platform, it monitors, analyzes, and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspirations in real time. By improving nutrition and achieving 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform greatly reduces hospital-acquired complications and speeds up ICU patient recovery. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.  Requirements:

title: Software Engineer
description: Innovid (NYSE:CTV) powers advertising delivery, personalization, measurement and outcomes across linear, CTV and digital for the world's largest brands. Through a global infrastructure that enables cross-platform ad serving, data-driven creative, and currency-grade measurement, Innovid offers its clients always-on intelligence to optimize advertising investment across channels, platforms, screens, and devices. Innovid is an independent platform that leads the market in converged TV innovation, through proprietary technology and exclusive partnerships designed to reimagine TV advertising. Headquartered in New York City, Innovid serves a global client base through offices across the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific. To learn more, visit innovid.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. We have a developer-centric culture, practice continuous deployment and no code ownership, and deal daily with the most advanced technologies and methodologies in software development, high scalability, and fully automated and tested pipelines. We're looking for top-notch, passionate developers to be part of our world-class R&D team. If you think you can handle a wide range of technologies, pushing code to production several times a day, working on a different part of our product code with every new task you getת and using the best practices in the industry? please contact us!

title: Back End Engineer (NodeJS)
description: FORTVISION’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than hundreds microservices, handling daily traffic of about 50 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies. Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. Responsibilities: You are an awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 2 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of NodeJS, AWS and know functional programming principles. You care about design and microservices architecture, take responsibility and can work independently.

title: Backend Software Developer - Israel
description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

title: Backend Software Developer - Israel
description: ART MEDICAL is a well-funded medical startup, developing cutting-edge technologies for ICU patients. Our smART+™ platform is an intelligent, sensor-based feeding system for critical care patients that aims to prevent life-threatening, in-hospital complications, such as ventilator-associated pneumonia, malnutrition, and acute kidney injury. With the introduction of Nutrition Management 2.0™ to critical care patient scoring systems, the smART+™ platform monitors, analyzes and prevents malnutrition and gastric aspiration in real time. By providing optimal nutritional care and achieving up to 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform improves the standard of care and helps ICU patients recover faster. We are looking for a Backend Software Developer to join our interdisciplinary group of software, firmware, and hardware engineers.

By improving nutrition and achieving 100% feeding efficiency, the smART+™ platform greatly reduces hospital-acquired complications and speeds up ICU patient recovery.
